abstract: Yearlong inquiry by New York City's Investigation Dept finds homeless shelter system, which houses 119,000 people and operates 145 shelters, is rife with health and safety violations; report notes problems are decades old and Homeless Services Dept has taken steps to address some concerns.
lead_paragraph: City investigators examining 25 shelters and temporary housing programs found that the sites “are too often unsafe and unhealthy for children and families,” a report said.

headline.main: Review of New York Shelter System Finds Hundreds of Violations
headline.print_headline: Squalor Plagues Shelters in New York, Report Says

snippet: City investigators examining 25 shelters and temporary housing programs found that the sites “are too often unsafe and unhealthy for children and families,” a report said.
